name: GlassFox - a clean theme
description: Take a walk on the glass side.... GlassFox - a complete theme - Maximum transparency - The tabs have 3D effect - Changed "Firefox-button" - And a lot more.... Try also addons made for this theme (menus, scrollbar, newtab, addon- & sidebars, dimmerfunction, etc), see below. ------------------- Edit: This theme will not work proper on Firefox v29 and later (when Australis was introduced). Please consider GlassFox - Australis theme.
additional_info:
GlassFox is a modded theme - mainly based on http://userstyles.org/styles/36813/drifus-firefox-4-project-aero-clean 

Created with focus on transparency AND visibility. That is a bit of a tradeoff, because I wanted a very glassy appearance.

Have a look and see if it attracts you!!
  
* More clear focus on the active tab, a "3D effect":
      - Imagine that the tabs is illuminated from above, and that inactive tabs is bended backwards
      - When you then hover over a tab, you will see this tab raise up, to a semi-mode
      - And when you click on a tab to select it, you will see the full 3D effect 
* Changed default tab-width min and max size (100px and 180px), edit the file if desired
* Changed font (Calibri), it's marked in the file where you can choose an another font if desired   
* Changed text-color on tabs as in screenshot  
* Almost hidden "Firefox-button" (visible as a tiny dropmark, expand as a small button when you hover + click in the upper left corner)
* Hidden statusbar 
* Replaced throbber icon
* Plus some other small stuff 

Please restart after installation.

ADDONS TO THIS THEME:

#1 If you would like semi-transparent menus in combination - highly recommended - check this out.... GlassFox - transparent menus http://userstyles.org/styles/53809/glassfox-transparent-menus?r=1316474807

#2 Transparent findbar, addonbar & bookmark/history sidebars (who are hidden until you hover). Install GlassFox - findbar, addonbar & sidebar (autohide)  http://userstyles.org/styles/60327/glassfox-findbar-addonbar-sidebar-autohide

#3 Maybe time to change the scrollbar's look? Why not install a matching GlassFox - the scrollbar http://userstyles.org/styles/60328/glassfox-the-scrollbar?r=1328288891

#4 If you prefer a "stamped 3D effect" on the inactive tabs, then install GlassFox - stamped tabs http://userstyles.org/styles/46157/glassfox-stamped-tabs?r=1302031937

#5 Since some backgrounds combined with clear glass sometimes makes it harder to view the tabs, you can also install GlassFox - dimmer on/off: http://userstyles.org/styles/45654/glassfox-dimmer-on-off?r=1301129353

#6 And if you want to change the text color on the tabs, install also GlassFox - change text color http://userstyles.org/styles/45746/glassfox-change-text-color

#7 The NewTab page is great, but looks dull... pimp it up with GlassFox - choose your personal NewTab http://userstyles.org/styles/70561/glassfox-choose-your-personal-newtab

OTHER INFO:

Works great with this old favorite http://userstyles.org/styles/20586/neon-link-focus
Tip 1: Looks best on medium or dark backgrounds, avoid too bright colored wallpapers.
Tip 2 (Win7/Vista): Get rid of those ugly white diagonal stripes behind all aero glass with this http://garbanzox.deviantart.com/art/AeroPlain-for-Windows-7-125999931
Tip 3: (Win8): Get Aero's glass effect back in Win8! WinaeroGlass http://winaero.com/comment.php?comment.news.204

Enjoy!
